document_data.name: Bartholomew Tidfigit
document_data.mainbody: '''Bartholomew Tidfigit''' was the owner of [[Royal Arms|The Royal Arms]] Inn in [[Luskan]] in the midâ€“14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Description: Bartholomew was tall and lean. His appearance was more akin to a scholar than a barkeep. He was generally curt with the customers. He did not pay mind to "smelly ruffians" who did not appear to be able to afford the luxurious accommodations of his inn.
document_data.Personality: Bartholomew Tidfigit was a life-long resident of Luskan. He was extremely proud of his establishment.
document_data.Relationships: Bartholomew was familiar with most established traders passing through and based in Luskan who could afford to regularly stay in his inn, such as [[Boswell Peddywinkle]].
document_data.History: Around [[Tarsakh]], [[1369 DR]], Bartholomew Tidfigit directed a group of adventurers looking for employment to Boswell Peddywinkle (secretly [[Celerum|Celerum the Black]]).
